content:
Just FYI, the macOS 11 rollout is starting today. However, they say it will take 8 weeks (!). I don't know if that means our builders will swap on/off the new version. I tested it recently, and I think we should be good (or, at least, the build finishes).

Also, XCode is migrating to XCode 13 (from 12.5.1) on October 18. I did not test that.
Why not just proactively switch the builders to macos-11?

We could definitely do that (and probably should), but that means keeping it updated over time. When macos-11 is removed, we'd run into a similar problem where our CI just shuts down, and then there is a scramble to fix things. We don't necessarily have the resources to proactively monitor image changes. The xcode default change is similar (and happens more often than OS changes), and would require someone monitoring when releases are added/removed.
proactively switch now to avoid flapping and then switch it back once the migration is complete?
